INTERSHOP IOM 5.1.0-SNAPSHOT Database Model   (revision 4a1c50c2496f75c744c3ed59aab72f0018db6f50)

Table admin.db_jobs

Tasks that can be performed by a single Postgres function call. A Quartz cron expression is used to define the recurrence pattern.

Columns 

References[1] Column Type Constraints[2] Default Comment
id integer PK, UNIQUE, NOT_NULL nextval('db_jobs_id_seq')  
active boolean NOT_NULL true Only active jobs will be run. 
function_name text NOT_NULL The postgres function to be called, possibly with schema prefix and quotes when it contains uppercase characters. 
configuration json NOT_NULL The expected function parameter. Along with the cron expression, this may be adapted for specific project requirements. 
cron_expression text NOT_NULL Quartz cron expression to determine the job recurrence. 
last_run timestamp without time zone '2000-01-01 00:00:00'::timestamp without time zone Will be set internally at each call. Used in combination with the cron_expression and active flag to determine due jobs. 

[1] Not all references are enforced by a foreign key where they could.
Such "missing" foreign keys are denoted with [[ ]].

[2] Constraints:
PK : the column is part of the primary key
UNIQUE: does don't cover unique constraints and indexes defined on more than one column.

Constraints and Indexes 

Type Name Definition
PRIMARY KEY db_jobs_pk PRIMARY KEY (id)
